title.narrative: EU Scheme for Young Professionals in BiH (Bosnia and Herzegovina)

description.narrative: The primary target group of the programme are young civil servants, with 1 to 7 years of professional experience, who work in the area of European Union integration across government levels in Bosnia and Herzegovina, with state-level institutions, two entities - Federation and Bosnia Hercegovina and Republika Srpska, Brcko District and ten cantons. Additionally, the secondary target group consists of civil servants acting as coordinators for the European Union integration affairs on behalf of different governments across Bosnia and Hercegovina.

The programme includes the delivery of the activities that correspond to four components envisaged under the project: 1. Information Campaign and Selection Process; 2. Executive Training Programmes; 3. Intra-Bosnia and Herzegovina Exchange and Western Balkans mobility programme; and 4. Networking, visibility and lessons learnt events and support of alumni activities.

The project is a two-year (24 months) capacity building programme for young civil servants funded by the European Union (EU) under the Instrument for Pre-Accession (IPA II). The project is being implemented by the British Council in Bosnia and Herzegovina from 1 February 2020 until 31 January 2022. The overall objective of the intervention is to assist Bosnia and Herzegovina in developing a professional, de-politicised and merit-based service system by providing professional development and mobility to the next generation of civil servants who will be in charge of the European Union accession process and lead change during the enlargement process.

The specific objectives are directly related to the overall objective and include the following: 1. To build the professional capacity of civil servants and instil their commitment to European Union oriented civil service, through their increased knowledge and understanding of the European Union accession process. 2. To foster mutual connections and mobility between agents of change through facilitating an intra-Bosnia and Herzegovina exchange and Western Balkans mobility programme.
